attributes.action: order an independent investigation into a catalogue of failings at Tameside General Hospital.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The hospital has one of the highest death rates in the country.
It scored just 4.8 out of 100 for patient safety in a report by Dr Foster - an independent body which collects information on health services.
An unannounced inspection by a Government watchdog recently found two breaches in the hospital's infection control.
Patient groups say they are being inundated with complaints about failings in basic care on the wards – particularly for older people who don't get the help they need to eat, drink, wash and go to the toilet. We believe  an independent investigation is  necessary to restore public confidence in the hospital services.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to order an independent investigation into a catalogue of failings at Tameside General Hospital.


Her Majesty's Government has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
